name: TownePlace Suites Columbus Airport Gahanna

reviews.text: The location is convenient to many attractions in Columbus, not just the airport (we were involved with a hockey tournament on the northeast side of town during our weekend stay). Nearby food runs from standard chain fare to a local BBQ joint.
reviews.title: Solid value

reviews.text: Our room (a two-bedroom suite) was quite clean, although one of the two skillets provided in the kitchen had been severely scorched by a previous guest. Bathroom, living room and bedroom furnishings were all in excellent condition. However, only one bedroom had a TV (much to our teenage son's dismay <g> ).
reviews.title: Great Stay
Nice Stay
reviews.text: We've stayed in TownePlace Suites a few times in the past couple of years because they are generally quite affordable and work well for families. This facility overall is typical for the brand.

Used my Marriott Points for my stay at this hotel. Nice, super clean room - seemed like it was brand new! The bottled water and the trail mix they left for me was a nice surprise since i didn't check in until after 10:30 pm. Convenient location to the airport and a shuttle is provided from 5AM to 11 PM which saved on cab fare if not renting a car. Hotel seemed to be in more of a residential area with the closest restaurants a little distance away (the hotel does offer a shuttle to Easton Town Centre if reserved in advance). Overall, a great stay, a nice staff, and all the amenities that they list on their website are available just as they advertise.
reviews.title: clean and comfortable

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at TownePlace Suites for 1 night before our flight to San Francisco. The room was clean and was very comfortable. Using name your own price on priceline we were very pleased to save over 1/2 compared to the average price. The kitchen came in handy as we had purchased eggs and sausage to prepare before our flight. Would stay again if flying out of Columbus.
reviews.title: Good, inexpensive choice near Port Columbus airport

reviews.text: My brother clued me into this hotel for an overnight early am flight kind of stay. I was traveling with kids and the front desk staff was great. They gave the kids little toys to take to the room, provided easy dinner info for nearby places and offered to put together breakfast stuff since we had to leave at 5am! Breakfast options were decent for a free breakfast - all prepackaged (cereals, juices, danishes, fruit and cereal bars) but perfect to take along or take back to your room. Room was $130 for a 2bd suite. The beds and furnishings were all decent and the beds were very comfortable with what seemed to be very clean linens and a nice assortment of pillows and extras. The bathroom soaps and shampoos were even nice. I'd stay here again without question.
reviews.title: Great Airport Hotel - well worth it.

reviews.text: I spent the night before my wedding with my maid of honor (my sister) and an out-of-town bridesmaid at this hotel. We had such a great visit! The mattresses were very strange (some sort of foam), but they were very comfortable. Having the mini kitchen was really nice for snacks and water. It was a little tight for three people, but my bridesmaid & I shared the queen, and my sister slept on the pull-out, so we survived. You can book a larger room, but Priceline just gives you what it does. The continental breakfast is nice; juices, breakfast bars, fruit, cereals, etc. Check-in and out went fine, and they do provide a shuttle between the hotel and the airport, which is probably quite handy. If you're looking for a comfortable place to stay, this is a great choice!
reviews.title: Great value!

likes.disliked: — Loud baseball team that got rained out of their games, so they spent their time terrorizing the floor. Thank goodness they had an early curfew, or I would have been very tired the day of my wedding!

reviews.text: Arrived at hotel. No one in lobby. Had to locate desk clerk. Checked into hotel. Assigned room. Requested crib. Was told I would have to drag crib to my room. Went to my room. Found someone in my room sleeping in my bed. Went back to front desk. Dragging crib behind me. Told desk clerk my story. She did not believe me. Assigned me to new romn. Found out later old guests had broken into room. So much for security. I was billed incorrect amount for room. No airport shuttle. Breakfast was not anything other than prepackaged breakfast bars. Difficult to find location.
reviews.title: Not the best, Not the worst
A wonderful, well-run hotel
reviews.text: After a long flight from London, my husband, sister and I stayed at the Columbus airport TownePlace Suites hotel. We had a two bedroom, two bath suite that was very nice. The hotel staff was particularly cheerful and interested in attending to our every need. The hotel was so clean and neat, inside and out. We were very impressed. It is not so near the airport that the roar of airplanes keeps you awake, but near enough so that there is not a long drive, either. They have a shuttle, too. I would highly recommend this hotel for any occasion, not just for a short stay between flights.

aka: Towneplace Suites Columbus Airport Gahanna Hotel Columbus
